text: LOS GATOS, Calif., May 18, 2023 /PRNewswire/ -- VitaSea announces the launch of its e-commerce website with five hero sun care products made for those with an active, outdoor lifestyle and an appreciation for environmental conservation. Formulated with sustainable and biodegradable ingredients, VitaSea products are hypoallergenic, dermatologist-tested and suitable for even the most sensitive skin. Fresh, bright and inviting; slightly addictive and never disappointing, it sets a new standard in what sun care should smell like. VitaSea is the next adventure for Noodle & Boo founder and entrepreneur Christine Burger. Whereas Noodle & Boo's philanthropic focus is children in need, VitaSea's purpose is to bring awareness and resources to the most urgent environmental concerns of our time. Leveraging twenty years of product development expertise comes a complete line of premium daily sun protection made with natural goodness from the sea and antioxidant rich vitamins. Sea Kelp, known to soothe irritation and inflammation, reduces the appearance of sun damage while brightening skin and replenishing the natural moisture barrier. VitaSea began with the premise that climate change is real and everyday choices either contribute to the problem, or become part of the solution. As a member of 1% for the Planet, VitaSea is a mission-driven brand committed to offering premium sun care products, while promoting conservation and supporting environmental issues that will reduce and offset CO2 emissions. text: Alco-bev brand Salud Beverages has announced its plans for expansion in 10 new Indian markets along with the upcoming launch of new products in the spirit-based Ready-to-Drink (RTD) category. The company is set to introduce its premium gin and Salud bitters to the Indian market next month. India's RTD alcohol market is projected to grow at an 11.2 per cent CAGR from 2022-2030. It has become increasingly popular among Gen-Z and millennials, who seek more convenient and healthy drink options that are low in sugar. Salud delivered 25,000 to 30,000 cases to the RTD market in the last fiscal year. Building on this success, it plans to invest $1.5 million to fuel growth in the alco-beverage market further. Moreover, the brand is expanding its product range by introducing three stock-keeping units (SKUs) based on distinct spirits, catering to a broader range of consumer preferences. The brand aims to establish a strong presence in key regions across India, including Karnataka, Goa, Telangana, Maharashtra, Orissa, Pondicherry, Kerala, Punjab, Uttar Pradesh, and Chandigarh. By targeting smaller and larger states, it wants to cater to a diverse range of consumers, offering its fashionable lifestyle and premium products to a wide audience. Ajay Shetty, CEO of Salud Beverages, said, "Our fashion-forward brand combines tradition and modernity, delivering exceptional drinking experiences. As we expand, our sole focus is the Indian market, where we aim to source and produce everything locally." Salud has established a distillery facility in Goa that incorporates canning technology, enabling it to introduce recyclable cans for its products. By prioritising cans over bottles, it is committed to environmental conservation by taking sustainable packaging seriously. The Bengaluru-based start-up also claims to be the first Indian brand to incorporate Non-fungible Tokens (NFTs) to offer an immersive experience to its customers. Besides its RTDs and non-alcoholic bitters, its Salud Merchandise is an exclusive line of clothing, while its music IP Salud Sessions holds exclusive tracks by various homegrown and international artists. Both these business divisions will launch new collections soon. In September 2021, Salud Beverages raised $1.1 million from investors, including actor Rana Daggubati, former managing director of Microsoft India Srinivas Koppolu, and Anthill Ventures. Earlier this year, global venture capital firm Anthill Ventures launched Anthill Spirits, a speed-scaling accelerator programme dedicated to supporting early-stage alco-bev start-ups. It aimed at providing funding and market access to entrepreneurs in India’s rapidly growing alco-bev industry, which is estimated to be around $50 billion by 2023.

text: Encourages Mindful luxury and Conservation of The Heritage BENGALURU, India, May 23, 2023 /PRNewswire/ -- Meticulously crafted by Diageo India, the artisanal Single Malt Whisky, Godawan, draws inspiration from its provenance. It embraces the profound Rajasthani ethos of cherishing beauty in scarcity while championing sustainability. The arid climatic conditions observed in Godawan contribute to a heightened "Angel's share" phenomenon, imparting an extraordinary flavour profile that enthrals the senses. To enhance its allure further, this exceptional whisky undergoes meticulous maturation in carefully selected casks infused with Indian botanicals. Godawan 100 Godawan, from Diageo India, country's leading beverage company, introduced Godawan Century, a bespoke 100-bottles-batch of limited-edition Single Malt, that pays homage to the Great Indian Bustard, popularly known as Godawan, on its first anniversary. The bird was once a ubiquitous sight across India but has now dwindled to just a little over hundred in number. Every single addition to the Godawan flock counts, and the brand is working wholeheartedly for the environmental conservation and ecological preservation of the bird. Godawan 100 marked the occasion with a mystical event held at Alila Fort, Bishangarh, Rajasthan, close to the natural habitat of the Godawan bird and the home of the spirit. Maharawal Chaitanya Raj Singh, the 44th King of Jaisalmer, known for his conservation efforts of the local heritage, joined in the celebration. The one-day immersive experience offered 30 guests a glimpse into the story of Godawan, accompanied with the sounds of Nagadas, besides an evening of four-course culinary experience and a sewan-seed making conservation activity. The brand also partnered with Amit Pasricha, the renowned photographer whose platform "India Lost & Found" pays an ode to timeless Indian monuments, once forgotten and now waiting to be rediscovered. Just like Pasricha and India Lost & Found call for the preservation of the heritage, a reminder of India's beautiful past, so does the rare and exclusive Godawan 100 collection, for the conservation of Godawan birds. The attendees of the grand product unveil were given exclusive Amit Pasricha prints as a memento. Godawan 100 is also an ode to the local Bishnoi community's tireless work towards the conservation of the Godawan bird, once in the running to be the national bird of India. Each bottle of Godawan 100 is unique, with a bespoke label that has a distinctive image of the bird. The case for each bottle has been mindfully crafted from old, bourbon casks that were once used for the maturation of the liquid. Shweta Jain, Chief Business Development Officer: Luxury, Reserve & Craft – India and South Asia, Diageo India, said, "In a world where discerning luxury consumers seek more than just premium products, Diageo India offers a holistic experience that embraces sustainability and responsible consumption. At the heart of it lies a deep appreciation for our rich heritage and a steadfast commitment to preserving it for future generations. In this spirit, we proudly present Godawan Century that embodies our values of mindful consumption and social consciousness." Expressing his thoughts on the launch, Vikram Damodaran, Chief Innovation Officer, Diageo India, said, "Godawan Century is a remarkable artisanal single malt with the raison d'etre of conservation of an endangered species. Each bottle is unique with a distinctive image of the bird, and the cases have been created from old, discarded casks. The liquid captures the exceptional essence of Rajasthan. We are proud to partner local communities to conserve Godawan and invite our consumers to join us in this journey of responsible consumption and mindful luxury." "Godawan Century celebrates not only the rich flavours of Rajasthan but also showcases Diageo's unwavering commitment to the conservation of the Great Indian Bustard. It is inspired by the authentic spirit of the desert and therefore, close to my heart, because Rajasthan is a true example of beauty in scarcity and conserving whatever nature gives us. We hope to ignite meaningful conversations about the importance of preserving this iconic bird and environmental conservation," said Maharawal Chaitanya Raj Singh, the 44th king of Jaisalmer on the launch of Godawan Century. "Just as India Lost & Found works tirelessly to raise consciousness about India's forgotten past, Godawan Century hopes to drive the conservation about nearly extinct Godawan birds. We have been trusted with truly remarkable geo-cultural legacies, and they are worth preserving. Godawan Century is an exemplary example of mindful luxury that seeks to change the world for the better," said Amit Pasricha, renowned photographer, and Founder, India Lost & Found. Godawan Century offers a unique and immersive experience that celebrates the heritage, culture, and flavours of Rajasthan, which the Great Indian Bustard and the artisanal single malt call home. The launch of Godawan Century showcased the brand's dedication to mindful luxury and the efforts to create a positive impact on society and the environment. About the liquid: Double matured in American Ex Bourbon and European Oak Casks Made from Indian six-row barley Matured at Alwar 101-Degree F Dark amber liquid, with a sweet and creamy palate that has an intense richness of fruits and grapes. This limited-edition whiskey's essence is aligned with Diageo India's commitment towards Society 2030: Spirit of Progress Plan. Last year, the company released its maiden ESG Index, which highlighted the multiple initiatives undertaken by the company during the year. These include the creation of a water replenishment capacity of 4,62,182 Cu.M annually and 84,000 litres of potable drinking water per day under its Water, Sanitation and Hygiene (WASH) programme. The company is working to replenish more water than it uses in water-stressed sites across its operating locations in India through reforestation, wetland restoration, desilting ponds and rainwater harvesting. About Diageo India Diageo India is the country's leading beverage alcohol company and a subsidiary of global leader Diageo Plc. The company manufactures, sells and distributes an outstanding portfolio of premium brands such as Johnnie Walker, Black Dog, Black & White, VAT 69, Antiquity, Signature, The Singleton, Royal Challenge, McDowell's No1, Smirnoff, Ketel One, Tanqueray, Captain Morgan and Godawan, an artisanal single malt whisky from India. Headquartered in Bengaluru, our wide footprint is supported by a committed team of over 3000 employees, 39 manufacturing facilities across states and union territories in India, a strong distribution network and a state-of-the-art Technical Centre. Incorporated in India as United Spirits Limited (USL), the company is listed on both the National Stock Exchange (NSE) and Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) in India. For more information about Diageo India, our people, our brands, and our performance, visit us at www.diageoindia.com. Visit Diageo's global responsible drinking resource, http://www.DRINKiQ.com , for information, initiatives, and ways to share best practices. Celebrating life, every day, everywhere. text: Retail India News: Juicy Chemistry and Mommy Shots by Amrita Unveil 'Scars are Beautiful' In honor of Women’s Day, Juicy Chemistry and Mommy Shots by Amrita join forces for the 'Scars are Beautiful' campaign, shedding light on the beauty of postpartum bodies and stretch marks. The campaign, launched on March 5th, 2024, features 11 mothers proudly displaying their bodies and sharing their motherhood experiences to inspire other women to embrace their bodies and change societal perceptions. Era Vashishta, mother of a 2.5-year-old shares her story “ I was diagnosed with chronic PCOD when I was 28, which got me very scared as to whether or not I would ever get pregnant or have a baby. I never thought of motherhood before this. Because of the PCOD it made me want to be a mom, because I thought maybe I might not happen. After which, I became a mom and everything changed. As soon as I met my baby that’s when I knew this is someone I want to protect for the rest of my life, the love is unconditional. It was so scary and overwhelming, but once you hang on to all these feelings you wouldn’t have it any other way, I’d never not want to be a mom. My scars are my tiger stripes, because I think I draw a lot of power from them. I’m a mom and this body gave birth to a life, which is what makes me bigger, it makes me a tiger.” Megha Asher, the Co-Founder and COO of Juicy Chemistry said, “At Juicy Chemistry, we believe in promoting self-love and body positivity, and we are thrilled to partner with Mommy Shots for this unique campaign. Through this powerful photo series, we hope to inspire and empower women to embrace their bodies, and scars not just physical but emotional ones as well, and celebrate their unique journeys of motherhood. As mothers ourselves, we understand the challenges that come with motherhood and the impact it can have on a woman's body and self-perception. We hope that this campaign will help shift the narrative and encourage women to see their bodies as beautiful and strong, no matter their shape or size. Together, we can create a more inclusive and diverse representation of beauty and promote self-love and acceptance for all women." Amrita Samant, Founder and CEO Mommyshots said, “In my world of photography, motherhood, babies and art, creating something meaningful that helps change the world obsessed with perfection was very close to my heart. We want to redefine beauty with every line and every scar that spells resilience strength and a unique journey, we want to go beyond the surface with this campaign. They’re more than blemishes, they’re badges of honor, they are tender and timeliness. I am super proud of the 11 women who came forward to normalize what the society has for far too long considered unsightly.” Sonia Chandrakumar, one of the 11 mothers who posed and actively participated in the shoot said, “The journey of motherhood is very different for me, I had a really tough time the first 6 months. I had all kinds of nausea, I could not brush my teeth and I had a lot of body changes that took place. My husband was my greatest support because he constantly reminded me that there’s something beautiful coming out of this and if you want something beautiful in life you need to cope with the changes that take place in your body or yourself. So I kept reminding myself and dealing with the challenges. I’d describe my marks as Caleb’s wonderful art palette that I have around my stomach. I would not want to get rid of my marks, I want to keep it as a memory.” Motherhood scars, resembling intricate battle scars, symbolize the strength and resilience embedded in a woman's journey. Each mark narrates a story of endurance and courage, celebrating the remarkable strength of women. In honoring these scars, we acknowledge the transformative power of motherhood, inspiring women to embrace their bodies and celebrate their unique journeys. #scarsarebeautiful

Colgate-Palmolive India has a strong distribution network that ensures its products are readily available across India. The company also focuses on engaging with consumers through marketing campaigns and oral health education initiatives. Colgate-Palmolive India is dedicated to sustainability and social responsibility. The company focuses on water conservation, waste reduction, and community development programs. Colgate’s “Bright Smiles, Bright Futures” program promotes oral health education and awareness among children in underprivileged communities. With its strong brand equity, focus on innovation, and commitment to social responsibility, Colgate-Palmolive (India) Limited continues to be a trusted and leading player in the Indian consumer goods industry, helping consumers maintain oral health and personal care. Patanjali Ayurved Limited – Patanjali Ayurved Limited is an Indian consumer products company founded by Yoga Guru Baba Ramdev and Acharya Balkrishna in 2006. The company is dedicated to promoting Ayurveda, the ancient Indian system of medicine, and offers a wide range of Ayurvedic products for personal care, healthcare, food and beverages, and more. Patanjali gained significant popularity in India due to its emphasis on natural and herbal ingredients, appealing to consumers seeking healthier alternatives. The company’s product portfolio includes items such as herbal medicines, skincare products, hair care products, health supplements, spices, and packaged food items. Patanjali Ayurved has positioned itself as a swadeshi (Indian-origin) brand, aiming to promote the use of indigenous products and revive traditional Ayurvedic practices. The company heavily markets its products, leveraging Baba Ramdev’s immense popularity as a yoga guru and spiritual figure. Over the years, Patanjali Ayurved has witnessed rapid growth and expansion. Its products are available through its extensive distribution network, which includes standalone Patanjali stores, as well as tie-ups with retail chains and e-commerce platforms. The company’s success has been driven by its ability to tap into the growing demand for natural and Ayurvedic products in India. However, it has also faced its share of controversies and scrutiny, particularly related to product quality and misleading advertising claims. Despite the challenges, Patanjali Ayurved has emerged as a significant player in the Indian consumer products industry, challenging established multinational and domestic companies. Its focus on Ayurveda and its ability to resonate with health-conscious consumers have helped it carve a niche in the market. CONCLUSION In 2023, consumer products companies in India are expected to continue their impressive growth. They will focus on expanding their customer base and launching new products to meet changing demands and preferences. They will also be striving to stay ahead of competitors by innovating and investing in technology and developing more efficient supply chains. Companies will focus on building stronger relationships with their customers and providing value for money. As the economy continues to grow and incomes rise, more people will be looking to buy quality products, which will create a huge potential market for Indian companies. The future looks bright for Indian consumer products companies, as they are sure to benefit from increased demand in the coming years.

text: INTRODUCTION In 2023, India is home to some of the world’s leading food and beverage companies. Amul is one of India’s largest dairy products companies, supplying milk and other dairy products to about 2.5 million retailers in India. ITC Foods is another primary food and beverage company, producing snack items, ready-to-eat foods, staples, beverages and confectionery products. Haldiram is a well-known brand in India for its snacks and sweets. Parle Products is a top biscuit manufacturer in India, with popular brands such as Parle-G, Monaco and Krackjack. Another Indian food company, Britannia Industries, produces cookies, bread, cakes, rusk and other bakery products. Coca-Cola, PepsiCo and Red Bull are some of the biggest global beverage companies operating in India. Cafe Coffee Day is India’s largest coffee chain, with over 1,700 outlets nationwide. Other notable food and beverage companies in India include Dabur, Nestlé India, Mars International India, and Mondelez India Foods. IMPORTANCE Food and beverage companies in India are expected to have a tremendous impact on the country’s economy in 2023. As the population grows and income levels rise, more and more people are able to purchase food and beverages. This increased demand has led to a surge in production from food and beverage companies. These companies are capitalizing on the growing middle-class population by introducing new products and expanding their existing product lines. India has seen a dramatic increase in the consumption of processed and convenience foods, which require fewer resources for production and are more convenient to prepare. This has allowed food and beverage companies to expand their market share and take advantage of the changing consumer preferences. In addition, India is also experiencing rapid urbanization. This creates an opportunity for food and beverage companies to tap into the rapidly growing urban market. Population growth, coupled with increasing disposable incomes, means that the demand for high-end, premium products will likely continue to grow. The government is also supporting the development of the food and beverage industry by providing incentives for investment and development. These incentives are encouraging more investment from both local and foreign companies. By 2023, the food and beverage industry is expected to be worth nearly US$40 billion. Overall, food and beverage companies in India are poised to have a significant impact on the country’s economy in 2023. With a large, growing population and increasing disposable incomes, these companies are well-placed to benefit from the changing consumer preferences and the rapid urbanization of India. Here are the top 10 best food & beverages companies in india in 2023 Amul – Amul is an Indian dairy cooperative based in Anand, Gujarat, India. Founded in 1946, it is a brand managed by a cooperative body, the Gujarat Co-operative Milk Marketing Federation Ltd (GCMMF), which today is jointly owned by 3.6 million milk producers in Gujarat. Amul’s products include milk powders, milk, butter, ghee, cheese, curd, ice cream, chocolate, shrikhand, paneer, and other dairy-based consumer goods. In addition to being the largest food brand in India, Amul is also the world’s largest producer of milk and milk products. The company has a presence in more than 20 countries across the world, including the United States, UAE, Australia, China, Nepal, Bangladesh, and Sri Lanka. Amul operates under the philosophy of ‘Operation Flood’, which seeks to ensure affordable and abundant availability of milk and milk products for Indian consumers. It focuses on providing quality milk and milk products for its consumers. The company also works towards improving the nutrition, health and livelihoods of farmers through various initiatives. Amul has a successful track record of innovation, introducing products like toned milk, flavoured milk, lactose-free milk and ice creams, cheese spreads, etc. Its corporate social responsibility efforts include establishing schools, health care centres, and community development projects. Amul has been awarded numerous accolades, including the National Award for Dairy Development, the World Food Award, and the Brand Laureate Hall of Fame Award. It is well known for its iconic mascot – The Amul Girl – which has become synonymous with the brand over the years. Nestle India – Nestle India is a multinational food and beverage company headquartered in Gurgaon, India. Nestle India is part of the Swiss-based Nestle Group, which is the world’s leading nutrition, health, and wellness company. Established in 1866, Nestle India is one of the oldest and largest food companies in India. Today, it has become a significant player in the Indian food market with its wide range of products. Nestle India offers a wide variety of products, including dairy products, chocolate and confectionery, coffee and tea, nutrition and health products, bottled water and pet food. Its portfolio includes popular brands like Maggi, KitKat, Nescafe, Milkmaid, Cerelac, Lactogen, Nan, Toned Milk, Nesplus, and many more. Nestle India also manufactures and distributes infant nutrition products such as Lactogen, Nan, and Cerelac. Besides manufacturing food and beverages, Nestle India also focuses on research and development. The company has established a research and development centre in Manesar, Haryana, which works on creating innovative food and beverage products that cater to the needs of today’s changing lifestyle trends. Nestle India also engages in various corporate social responsibility initiatives, such as providing nutrition education, environmental conservation, water conservation, and infrastructure support in rural areas. The company also reaches out to customers through extensive marketing campaigns, using digital platforms, TV commercials, print media, radio campaigns, outdoor campaigns, and point-of-sale activation. Nestle India has successfully established itself as one of the leading food and beverage companies in India. With its focus on innovation, sustainability, quality, and customer satisfaction, Nestle India will continue to be a strong player in the Indian market for many years to come. Hindustan Unilever Limited – Hindustan Unilever Limited (HUL) is a leading Indian consumer goods company with a presence in more than 20 countries across Asia, Africa, and the Middle East. Founded in 1933 as Lever Brothers India Ltd., it has since grown to become one of India’s largest Fast Moving Consumer Goods (FMCG) companies, with over 35 brands spanning multiple categories such as home care, personal care, foods and refreshments, fabrics and garments, agri-business, and water purification.HUL’s mission is to ‘meet the everyday needs of people everywhere, with its brands and services’. The company has a strong track record of innovation and leadership, including the launch of many successful products like Surf Excel, Lifebuoy, Fair & Lovely, Kwality Wall’s, Ponds, Sunsilk, Vaseline, Dove, Lux, Lipton, Bru, Knorr, Kissan, and Magnum. HUL also has an impressive distribution network that covers over 6 million retail outlets across India, providing access to their products to consumers from all socio-economic backgrounds. In addition to its vast product range, HUL has invested heavily in its corporate social responsibility initiatives, particularly in rural areas. This includes supporting initiatives for reducing poverty, improving health and nutrition, promoting education, empowering women, and protecting the environment. The company also works closely with local communities to create safe, healthy working environments and provide employment opportunities. Overall, Hindustan Unilever Limited is a leading FMCG company that is committed to delivering quality products and services to customers around the world. With its innovative products, extensive distribution network, and commitment to sustainability, HUL continues to be a leader in India’s consumer goods industry. ITC Limited – ITC Limited is a major Indian conglomerate headquartered in Kolkata, West Bengal. Founded in 1910 as the Imperial Tobacco Company of India, it has since diversified into five distinct business segments: Fast Moving Consumer Goods (FMCG), Hotels, Paperboards & Packaging, Agri Business and Information Technology. The company includes cigarettes, packaged snacks and ready-to-eat meals, writing instruments, stationery products, apparel, packaging, agri-business, safety matches, and lifestyle retailing. ITC’s FMCG segment is its largest business and accounts for nearly 80% of its total revenues. It has a wide range of products, from staples such as Aashirvaad Atta, Sunfeast biscuits and Yippee noodles to luxury items like Vivel soap and Candyman chocolates. The hotel’s division of ITC operates over 100 hotels across India under the brand names ITC Grand, WelcomHotel, Fortune, Sheraton and Welcome Heritage. Its recent acquisitions include ITC Maurya in New Delhi, ITC Sonar in Kolkata, and the Chairman’s Collection hotels across India. ITC’s paperboard and packaging business is the second largest in India. It produces a range of top-quality products, such as coated and uncoated papers, cartons, bags, labels, sacks and cylinder boards, which are used by a variety of industries. Its agri-business division is engaged in the production and distribution of farm commodities, with a focus on tea, wheat and edible oils. It also produces a range of organic and organic-certified agriculture products. Finally, ITC’s information technology division provides end-to-end IT services to the other divisions of the group. It also offers IT consulting, R&D services, software development and maintenance services, and data centre operation and management. Pepsico India – PepsiCo India is a subsidiary of the global food and beverage giant PepsiCo Inc. It was established in 1989 and has since become one of the leading food and beverages companies in the country. With its headquarters located in Gurugram, it has a vast network of over 4 million outlets across the country. PepsiCo India currently employs more than 25,000 people in India and serves over 1.3 billion Indians. Its portfolio includes iconic brands such as Pepsi, Mountain Dew, 7UP, Mirinda, Tropicana, Lays, Kurkure, and Slice. In addition to these, it also has many other brands like Quaker Oats, Gatorade, Aquafina, Lipton Ice Tea, Uncle Chipps, and Cheetos. The company focuses on creating products that meet the needs of Indian consumers and offer them healthy snacks, refreshing drinks, and nutritious foods. The company is committed to environmental sustainability and uses recycled PET for packaging. They are involved in various CSR initiatives, such as promoting water conservation and providing clean drinking water to rural communities. PepsiCo India works with farmers to ensure sustainable agriculture practices and promote the development of local agri-food businesses in rural areas. The company has often collaborated with NGOs and local governments to provide educational opportunities and livelihoods to local communities. In order to make its operations efficient and reduce waste, PepsiCo India has implemented state-of-the-art technologies in its production processes. It has also invested in innovative, eco-friendly packaging technology. Overall, PepsiCo India is an innovative and forward-thinking company that strives to create a positive societal impact while creating value for its stakeholders. Britannia Industries – Britannia Industries is an Indian food-products corporation based in Kolkata, West Bengal. It was founded in 1892 and is among India’s oldest and most popular brands. Britannia is the market leader in the bakery segment and number two in the dairy segment in India. The company produces a wide range of products, including biscuits, breads, cakes, dairy products like cheese, butter, ghee, dahi, milk, and snacks and ready-to-eat products such as cakes and rusk. Britannia is also a well-known exporter of its products to other countries. The company has a network of 30,000 stockists, 4,500 distributors and more than 50 plants nationwide, with a strong presence in urban areas. It also has a diverse portfolio that includes a range of offerings from health foods to indulgences. Britannia employs over 9,000 people in direct and indirect roles. In recent years the company has focused on brand building and product innovation with campaigns such as ‘Eat Healthy, Think Better’ and ‘Treat Yourself Tastefully’. To keep up with changing tastes, Britannia has launched several new products, including ‘Treat’, which is a range of biscuits with exotic flavours, ‘Indulge’, which is a range of cakes and pastries, ‘Good Day’, which is a range of healthier biscuits and ‘NutriChoice’ which is a range of healthier snacks. They have also launched ‘Just Right’, which is a range of breakfast cereals. Besides its products, Britannia is also active in CSR activities in areas such as health, education and rural development. The company works with NGOs to help provide free meals to farmers and underprivileged children and has even set up its own schools to educate rural students. Britannia also focuses on environmental protection by reducing emissions and waste during production. Haldiram’s – Haldiram’s is a renowned Indian food and beverage company that has carved a niche for itself in the industry. Founded in 1937 as a small retail sweet and namkeen shop in Bikaner, Rajasthan, Haldiram’s has grown to become a household name in India. The company offers a wide range of food and beverage products, specializing in traditional Indian snacks, namkeens (savoury snacks), sweets, and ready-to-eat meals. With its focus on quality ingredients, authentic flavours, and hygienic production processes, Haldiram has gained the trust and loyalty of millions of consumers across India. Haldiram’s products are known for their taste, variety, and consistent quality. From crispy bhajia and crunchy samosas to delectable rasgullas and gulab jamuns, Haldiram caters to the diverse taste preferences of Indian consumers. The company also offers a range of ready-to-eat meals, including curries, biryanis, and paneer dishes, providing convenience without compromising on taste and quality. With a robust distribution network, Haldiram’s products are available in various formats, including retail stores, online platforms, and dedicated outlets. The brand has expanded its presence beyond India and has a global footprint, with exports to several countries. Haldiram’s success can be attributed to its commitment to maintaining traditional recipes, adapting to evolving consumer preferences and ensuring customer satisfaction. The company has consistently focused on innovation, introducing new flavours and products to cater to changing trends and demands. Overall, Haldiram’s has become synonymous with authentic Indian snacks and sweets, reflecting the rich culinary heritage of the country. It remains a trusted and beloved brand, delighting consumers with its delectable offerings and establishing itself as a leading food and beverage company in India. Coca-Cola India – Coca-Cola India Company is one of the largest beverage companies in the world and is a subsidiary of The Coca-Cola Company. It has been present in India since 1956 when it signed a bottling agreement with Parle Agro. The company manufactures, markets, distributes and sells beverages that include Coca-Cola, Sprite, Fanta, Thums Up, Kinley, Limca, Maaza, Minute Maid and Georgia. The company also provides syrup concentrate to authorized bottling partners for the production of soft drinks in India and around the world. Coca-Cola India has a strong presence in rural and urban areas nationwide. Its distribution network covers over 1.6 million outlets across India. Coca-Cola India focuses on sustainability and works towards protecting the environment, conserving water resources and recycling plastic bottles. It has committed to the Indian government’s nationwide efforts to provide safe drinking water to millions of people in rural India. Additionally, Coca-Cola India has invested in numerous projects such as rainwater harvesting, afforestation and educational campaigns to create a positive impact in communities across the country. Parle Products Pvt Ltd – Parle Products Pvt Ltd is one of the leading companies in India that specialize in manufacturing confectionery and biscuit products. Founded in 1929, Parle Products operates across India, the Middle East, Africa and select international markets. The company is renowned for renowned brands like Parle-G, Hide & Seek, Monaco, Krackjack, Mango Bite, KrackJack, Melody, Poppins and many more. Parle Products Pvt Ltd has a vast network of factories and offices in India. This helps them provide customers with consistent, high-quality products. Their manufacturing plants are equipped with advanced technology and modern production processes. These processes ensure that their products meet the stringent standards of food safety regulatory authorities such as FSSAI. The company employs a team of dedicated professionals who are driven to create customer value through innovative ideas and technological advancements. Through research and development, they strive to develop new products and services that can help grow their business. As a part of their commitment to sustainability, they make sure that all their operations are conducted in an eco-friendly manner. Parle Products Pvt Ltd’s commitment to the environment extends beyond its factories and offices. They have taken a number of initiatives to reduce their carbon footprint. This includes implementing energy-efficient lighting systems, increasing the use of renewable energy sources and using green packaging materials. In 2018, Parle Products won the Golden Palm Award from the World Economic Forum for its efforts in promoting sustainable practices. The company is a proud member of the UN Global Compact and has received numerous awards and accolades for its commitment to excellence and sustainability. Dabur India Limited – Dabur India Limited is one of the leading Indian companies in the field of health care and natural products. Founded in 1884, Dabur India has grown from a small family-run business to a multi-billion dollar conglomerate with a portfolio ranging from herbal remedies to health supplements and personal care products. Dabur India produces a variety of products that are based on traditional Ayurvedic medicines. The company also manufactures various modern-day products, such as hair oils, shampoos, toothpaste, and ointments. In addition, it produces health beverages, energy drinks, juices, and syrups. Dabur India prides itself on its commitment to quality and health. The company follows strict guidelines to ensure the safety and efficacy of its products. All ingredients used are tested for purity and potency, and experts regularly review the products before they reach the market. Dabur India takes great pride in its social responsibility initiatives. The company contributes to various charitable causes, including education, health and hygiene programs. It also collaborates with the government to promote awareness about health risks and preventive measures. Additionally, Dabur India is committed to sustainability and green initiatives. Its factories are designed to reduce emissions, conserve water and recycle waste materials. Furthermore, the company works with local communities to support the growth of their agricultural sector. Overall, Dabur India is a leading manufacturer of health care and natural products in India. Its commitment to quality, innovation, and social responsibility makes it an exemplary organization in the industry. CONCLUSION In 2023, the food and beverage industry in India is expected to reach a value of nearly $1.7 trillion, making it one of the largest sectors in the country. The growth is driven by increasing consumer spending, urbanization, a growing middle-class population, rising incomes, and more health-conscious consumers. Major companies in this sector include Nestle, Hindustan Unilever, Amul, ITC, PepsiCo, Coca-Cola, Dabur, and Britannia, among others. Overall, the sector is projected to continue its positive performance in the coming years due to increased demand and higher spending power of consumers.
